Class WaveStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • WaveStatus

  • public class WaveStatus
extends greenfoot.Actor
    An ability bar that displays a customizable circular cooldown timer. Update methods can either take input values to change the value of the widget manually, or it can be activated or deactivated by a boolean at a modifiable cooldown speed.
    Version:
    October 1st 2018
    Author:
    Kevin Biro

    • Constructor Detail

      • WaveStatus

        public WaveStatus(int size,
                  char hotkey,
                  greenfoot.Color borderColor,
                  int transp,
                  int borderThickness)
        Constructs a basic ability bar with a customizable size, activation key display, border color, transparency and border thickness.
        Parameters:
        size - The radius of the widget (ideal: 50-200)
        hotkey - The character that is drawn at the bottom left of the image to show the user which key they need to press in order to activate the ability (use ' ' if you don't want to display anything). This does not set the key press functionality, it only displays a character.
        borderColor - The border color of the widget (set this color to one that is visible on your current background)
        transp - The transparency of the widget (ideal: 80-255)
        borderThickness - The thickness of the border (ideal: 2-20)

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Continuously checks if the animation has begun. When it has, will animate the cooldown until finished or paused.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor

      • drawWidget

        public void drawWidget()
        Clears the image and draws the widget border and the hotkey in the bottom left corner.

      • getAngle

        public int getAngle()
        Return the angle from the start position to the current position
        Returns:
        int Returns a rounded value of the current angle

      • update

        public void update(greenfoot.Color c1,
                   int transparency,
                   int startRotation,
                   int degrees)
        Sets the value of the cooldown animation with an input in degrees. You can also set the color, transparency and start rotation. The cooldown will be filled in to the value of the input in degrees so you must use this method when you want to change the amount filled into the circle.
        Parameters:
        c1 - The color of the animation/cooldown
        transparency - The transparency of the widget (ideal: 80-255)
        startRotation - The starting rotation in degrees of the loading animation (Ex: 0,90,180,257)
        degrees - The amount in degrees that you want filled in. Set 0 to clear and 360 to fill (range of accepted values:0-360)
